greeting.text: You look tired, child. The streets wear on us all. I'm Sister Agatha - I run the almshouse here. We do what we can for those the city forgets. What brings you to me?

choices.text: I'd like to help with your work here.
I'm looking for information about the Lower Ward.

grateful_for_help.text: Bless you! We always need willing hands. Right now, I need someone to deliver bread vouchers to families in the Ward. The baker donates day-old loaves, but the families can't always make the journey. Will you take these?

choices.text: Of course. I'll deliver them right away.
Is there any payment for this work?

explain_almshouse.text: We feed sixty souls a day, sometimes more. Orphans, widows, those too sick or old to work. The city gives us nothing - we survive on charity and the sweat of volunteers. It's never enough, but we make do. We must.

choices.text: That's admirable work. You're making a real difference.
Here, take this coin for your work.

ward_knowledge.text: *eyes narrow* Information, is it? The Lower Ward keeps its own counsel. We protect our own here. But... you seem decent enough. What do you need to know?

choices.text: Where's safe to rest in the Ward?
I need to find... discrete services.

give_vouchers.text: May the road rise to meet you. Here are the vouchers and addresses. These families are counting on you. Return when you're done - there's always more work for willing hearts.

explain_payment.text: *sighs* Child, if I had coin to spare, would these people be hungry? The payment is knowing you've fed a family today. Though... those you help often remember kindness. The Ward has its own ways of rewarding good deeds.

choices.text: You're right. I'll take the vouchers.
I need paying work. I'm sorry.

appreciate_understanding.text: Few understand anymore. The city grows richer while its people grow hungrier. But we persist. Every meal served, every child sheltered - it matters. Thank you for seeing that.

accept_donation.text: *eyes widen* Bless you, child! Every copper helps. This will buy bread for three families tomorrow. You've done more good than you know. The Ward remembers such kindness.

safety_advice.text: Brother Marcus runs an honest house - his tavern's safe enough. The main squares are watched by locals who don't tolerate trouble. But stay clear of the warehouse district after dark. Even I don't go there alone.

careful_response.text: *long pause* I feed the hungry, child. I don't judge how they fill their bellies. But if you walk in shadows, walk carefully. The Contact at the old warehouse might... help. Tell no one I sent you.

understand_need.text: I understand, child. We all must eat. When your fortunes change, remember us. The almshouse door is always open.
